page.title: 14The Railway,Kinbrace
page.content: The railway line from Helmsdale to Georgemas was completed in 1874.It cost Â£110,000,Â£60,000 being provided by the then Duke of Sutherland and the rest by the Highland Railway Company. So a station was built here and in later years all the buildings which are in our village.The stone for the houses and station came from quarries at Altnabreac and was taken in horse drawn carts to the site where the masons dressed it.All these houses are now either derelict or sold to other people and Kinbrace is a request stop.All that remains at Kinbrace is a waiting room.The gates have been replaced by automatic lights and this month a new lighting system has been installed.Three trains go up the line and three down daily.
